intro: Elatostema medogense var. medogense, commonly known as the Medog Elatostema, is a perennial herb native to the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, commonly known as the nettle family, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude habitats.
